title.narrative: SB: Telecommunications and ICT Development Project

description.narrative: The Project aims to facilitate increased access to a wide variety of reliable and affordable telecommunications services for the majority of the Solomon Islands population through efficient and well-regulated competition. The Project will support the development of a new regulatory institution#the Telecommunications Commission#designed to promote good governance in the sector. Further, through support for enabling infrastructure, the Project will pave the way for more widespread application of information communication technologies (ICT) supporting economic and social development, including greater opportunities for women.

condition.narrative: Appointment and maintenance of Project management staff (coordinator)
Eastablishment and maintenance of Consultative Group for Project and sector reform oversight

title.narrative: Impact on Telecom sector of World Bank Technical Assistance (composite score: 1- low impact to 5-high impact)

comment.narrative: Baseline value in PAD.
ICT sector fully competitive; stable market environment; functioning independent regulator.
Expected by YR5

actual.value: None but basic strategy to be prepared with support from ICT policy specialist.

comment.narrative: Commercial rollout still ongoing, so will be launched in late 2013.
Expected in YR2
Review in 2013.
Expected in YR2
Spectrum monitoring equipment procured and installed.Spectrum management consultations planned.
Expected in YR2

target.value: Interconnection regime in place and functioning

comment.narrative: Expected in YR2

target.value: Dispute resolution and mediation procedure in place

comment.narrative: Limited access to telephony.
Increasing network rollout to remoter islands.

title.narrative: Decrease in tariffs of key communications services

baseline.value: February 2010 tariffs for local mobile calls; calls to Australia; & 128kpbs Internet access

comment.narrative: See sub indicators.
Tariffs for several services have been reduced, notably for mobile broadband.

title.narrative: Legal and regulatory framework more effective at delivering sector performance

comment.narrative: Telecoms Law enacted August 2009. Regulatory framework to be developed.

actual.value: Key sector regulations in place and enforced by TCSI.

comment.narrative: End target defined in terms of regulations in line with international best practice in place and implemented as needed. Progressindevelopment of regulatory framework for new licensing, general authorizations, interconnection, spectrum, numbering.

title.narrative: Create conducive environment for competition through establishment of a regulatory authority

comment.narrative: Need to introduce second-generation regulation, in era of convergence.
Independent Regulator established and staffed. Basic regulatory framework in place. New licensing regime

The cost of a one minute local mobile call is US$0.13-US$0.27 per minute (STL-Bemobile=US$0.20, Bemobile-STL=US$0.22,STL-fixed=US$0.27, Bemobile-fixed=US$0.24, STL-STL=US$0.13 and Bemobile-Bemobile=US$0.18).

title.narrative: Internet service (128 kbps), business monthly rate

comment.narrative: Ranges from $2.61 to $2.64.
Both operators upgrading networks and services and are selectively upgrading from 2G to 3G services.

title.narrative: Mobile and fixed-line telephone subscribers per 100 people
New ICT policy framework formulated and adopted

target.value: ICT policy framework and capacity in place

actual.value: Updated ICT policy pending. Capacity still limited.

comment.narrative: ICT policy framework development in place.

title.narrative: Improved ICT policy environment in the country.

baseline.value: Basic Telecoms Policy in place, as adopted by Cabinet in 2008

actual.value: ICT policy inputs documents prepared for consultation.

comment.narrative: Improved ICT policy environment defined in terms of available policy documentation, and capacity to update and implement. ICTPolicy specialist deliverables specified in TOR. Will work with MOCAIT, MOFT and Consultative Group. MOCAIT ICT Director andDeputy Director to be recruited.

title.narrative: Increase in the level of competition in the ICT sector

comment.narrative: 5 active market participants: STL, Bemobile, Satsol, Pointcruz and Smile. Six other class licenses awarded. Class licensing regime.
Settlement Agreement provides basic regulatory framework for transition from monopoly to competition.

title.narrative: Telecommunications Commissioner and staff appointed and retained

comment.narrative: Continuing need to manage staff retention risk.
